fields.name: siteID
fields.title: Site ID
fields.description: A unique within dataset string identifier for the site. Valid values include strings that are used specifically for this survey or URIs from BDR Sites that have been established in previous surveys.

fields.name: siteIDSource
fields.title: Site ID Source
fields.description: The organisation that assigned the SiteID to this Site

fields.name: siteType
fields.title: Site Type
fields.description: The type of site that relates to its sampling type and/or dimensions.

fields.name: siteName
fields.title: Site Name
fields.description: A name for the site that may be more descriptive than the siteID.

fields.name: siteDescription
fields.title: Site Description
fields.description: The site (plot) description covers important aspects of the site (generally of the land surface). Some overlap in collected information does occur due to the modular nature of the survey processes. The description provides significant background information to gain an appreciation of the plot history, topography, position in the landscape and for understanding the likely relationship between the soils, vegetation and fauna.

fields.name: habitat
fields.title: Habitat
fields.description: A collection of habitat types representing the dominant vegetation structural formation class adopted by the National Vegetation Information System (NVIS).

fields.name: relatedSiteID
fields.title: Related SiteID
fields.description: Identifier of a related site to the specified site e.g. parent site, same site with different identifier.
fields.example: Same as within dataset or existing URI

fields.name: relationshipToRelatedSite
fields.title: Relationship To Related Site
fields.description: Relationship between the site and the related site. This field can be used to record Site identifiers for the same site from different custodians through the use of URIs.
fields.example: Same as within dataset or existing URI

fields.name: decimalLatitude
fields.title: Decimal Latitude
fields.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic origin of a Site. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 0, inclusive for Southern hemisphere.

fields.name: decimalLongitude
fields.title: Decimal Longitude
fields.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic origin of a Site. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between 0 and 180, inclusive for the BDR use case.

fields.name: footprintWKT
fields.title: Footprint WKT
fields.description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines the Site. A Site may have both a point-radius representation and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.

fields.name: geodeticDatum
fields.title: Geodetic Datum
fields.description: The geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given for the Site are based.

fields.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
fields.title: Coordinate Uncertainty in Meters
fields.description: The horizontal distance (in metres) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Site. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

fields.name: dataGeneralizations
fields.title: Data Generalizations
fields.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form.
fields.example: Coordinates given in decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, easting and northing have been rounded to 0.1 DEG. The observer name has been changed to a unique User ID.

fields.name: surveyID
fields.title: SurveyID
fields.description: The identifier of the Survey that the Site is related to in this dataset.

fields.name: siteVisitID
fields.title: Site Visit ID
fields.description: The unique key assigned to a visit. A visit is a time distinct assessment conducted within a survey at a designated site.

fields.name: siteVisitStart
fields.title: Site Visit Start
fields.description: The temporal start of when the Site was being used to collect data for the survey. Expected values include date, dateTime, dateTimeStamp.

fields.name: siteVisitEnd
fields.title: Site Visit End
fields.description: The temporal end of when the Site was being used to collect data for the survey. Expected values include date, dateTime, dateTimeStamp.

fields.name: visitOrgs
fields.title: Visit Orgs
fields.description: The names of the organisations responsible for recording the original Occurrence.
fields.example: NSW Dept of Planning, Industry and Environment.

fields.name: visitObservers
fields.title: Visit Observers
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated using |) of names of people, groups, or organisations responsible for recording the original Occurrence.
fields.example: Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson

fields.name: condition
fields.title: Condition
fields.description: The state of a patch of vegetation at the time of sampling relative to some specified standard or benchmark (where available).
